critique: The document is an executive order regarding the termination and liquidation of the Office of Temporary Controls in 1947. It transfers various functions related to price controls, subsidies, and other economic regulations to different government departments like the Department of Agriculture, the Reconstruction Finance Corporation, and the Department of Commerce. The order also addresses the transfer of records, property, and personnel to the relevant agencies. The document reflects a move towards deregulation and decentralization of control after World War II.
